1.text: Pick up a bag of peeled, deveined shrimp.

2.text: Place the shrimp in a colander or wire strainer.

3.text: Submerge the colander or strainer in a bowl of cool water.

4.text: Transfer the thawed shrimp to a layer of folded paper towels.

5.text: Heat the shrimp briefly to release any remaining liquid (optional).

6.text: Fill a large pot 3/4 of the way up with water.

7.text: Bring your water to a high boil.

8.text: Add whole spices and other flavorings to your cooking liquid (optional).

10.text: Drain your boiled shrimp thoroughly in a colander or wire strainer.

12.text: Toss your shrimp in dry spices for a burst of added flavor.

13.text: Spread out your thawed shrimp on a nonstick baking sheet.

14.text: Broil the shrimp for 5-8 minutes, or to the desired doneness.

15.text: Remove your shrimp safely from the oven using an oven mitt.

16.text: Heat 1–2 tablespoons (15–30 mL) of oil or butter in a large skillet.

17.text: Add garlic or other aromatics to your oil for additional flavor.

18.text: Add your shrimp to the skillet and sauté them for 4-5 minutes.

19.text: Let your shrimp cool for 1-2 minutes before eating them.
